key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel consistently shows higher pricing than Qatar Airways' site with 64% of itineraries priced higher.
The MSE channel demonstrates strong price competitiveness with 71% of itineraries being priced lower than the airline website.
The GDS channel presents a trend towards higher pricing, with 51.21% of itineraries being more expensive than the airline's site.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Overall, the OTA prices tend to be higher, with 64% of itineraries costlier on OTAs than Qatar Airways' site.
OTA prices are comparable or less expensive only in a marginal number, specifically 0.38% of itineraries.
1 in 14 offers were not found on the OTA, consistent over weeks and months.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Same pricing instances decreased both week-over-week and month-over-month, by 3.77% and 7.67% respectively.
The OTA higher category saw growth, with a 3.91% increase compared to the previous week and 7.19% month-over-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 76% of short-haul routes have higher OTA prices, climbing by over 8% from last month.
Long-haul OTA higher pricing rose 5.91% over the past week, although overall less prevalent than short-haul.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From QA origins, 62% of offers are higher on OTA, with a slight increase by 2.71% over last week.
Non-QA origin routes have shown a 5.26% increase in OTA higher pricing week-over-week.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close in bookings are predominantly OTA higher at 62%, showing a 4.75% increase from last week.
Far out bookings also lean towards higher OTA pricing, notably with a 2.60% week-over-week rise.

mse_highlights.line_content: 71% of itineraries on the MSE channel show lower fares than the airline's direct site. This indicates competitive pricing strength in the MSE channel.
The percentage of prices that remain the same between the MSE channel and the airline's website increased by 5.06% week over week, suggesting a growing alignment.
There was a 4.95% decrease in incidents where the MSE channel offered lower fares compared to the previous week, which may indicate a pricing strategy adjustment.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_title: Website Offers Not Found on MSE
mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The frequency of not finding offers on the MSE channel decreased by 12% from the previous week, indicating improved offer visibility.
Only 0.26% of offers on MSE are priced higher than the airline's website, with little change over the weeks and months.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, 76% of itineraries are priced lower on MSE, maintaining competitive leverage over the airline site with a slight 4.89% decrease from last week.
Long-haul itineraries maintain a significant portion of lower fares on MSE, valued at 81%, with minimal changes over the last month.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From Qatar, 75% of itineraries show lower fares on MSE, reflecting substantial discounts compared to the airline's direct channel, albeit with a 9.43% drop from the previous week.
For non-Qatar routes, MSE retains a lower pricing edge in 80% of cases, with relatively stable figures and a minimal decrease of 0.33% from last week.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings on MSE show lower fares for 81% of itineraries, although there has been a 4.38% reduction in occurrences of lower pricing since last week.
Far-out bookings have shown an increase, with 69% of itineraries featuring lower fares on MSE, marking improvement with a significant 6.4% week-over-week drop.

gds_highlights.line_content: The majority of prices in the GDS channel were higher than on the airline's website, with 'GDS Higher' status observed on 51.21% of all records in the latest week.
Same pricing across channels is showing a slight decrease, now at 46.36% in the latest week compared to previous metrics.
Instances where GDS prices were lower than the airline's website were minimal, accounting for just 0.51% of records in the latest week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances of offers not found in GDS decreased by 0.15% from the previous week to the latest week, stabilizing at 1.92% of cases.
The frequency of GDS prices being higher increased by 6% in the last week, indicating a growing trend towards premium pricing in this channel.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: In the short-haul segment, GDS prices were frequently higher with a 7.40% increase from the previous week, indicating a consistent trend.
Long haul routes maintained a strong price parity of 65.66% in the latest week, showing stability in this segment.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating in Qatar, GDS higher pricing occurred in 47.33% of cases in the last week, up 3.11% from the previous period.
Non-Qatar originating flights saw GDS higher prices in 55.38% of cases, marking a significant 9.33% increase from the previous week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings had 47.67% of prices higher than the website, with a notable 6.90% increase compared to the previous week.
Far-out booking windows exhibited a modest increase in higher GDS pricing, reaching 57.99% with a 4.15% rise from last week.
